message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.AR 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper discusses polar codes, which are a topic of interest in information theory. 
2. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a novel scheme for decoding polar codes, which can be considered a control problem. 
3. cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper discusses the parallel nature of belief propagation decoding and proposes a scheme to reduce computation complexity, which can be relevant to distributed and parallel computing. 
4. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the latency and throughput of polar code decoders, which can be relevant to networking and internet architecture. 
5. cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) - The paper discusses the energy dissipation of polar code decoders, which can be relevant to hardware architecture.
